oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of prepartum energy balance on neutrophil function following pegbovigrastim treatment in periparturient cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: McDougall, Scott
Rapnicki, Paul
LeBlanc, Stephen
Heiser, Axel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: periparturient
undernutrition
neutrophil
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Treatment with granulocyte colony stimulating factor (GCSF) increases neutrophil (PMN) count and enhances PMN function in the periparturient cow. It was hypothesized that prepartum undernutrition might reduce the effect of a commercial recombinant bovine G-CSF product (pegbovigrastim; Imrestor (IMR), Elanco) on PMN count and function. Hence the objective of this study was to test the effect of undernutrition for 1 month prior to calving on the response to IMR.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2017; 243
